text: Aspergillus silvaticus is a species of fungus in the genus Aspergillus. It is from the Silvati section. The species was first described in 1955. Fennell, D.I.; Raper, K.B. 1955. New species and varieties of Aspergillus. Mycologia. 47:68-89 ==Growth and morphology== A. silvaticus has been cultivated on both Czapek yeast extract agar (CYA) plates and Malt Extract Agar Oxoid® (MEAOX) plates. The growth morphology of the colonies can be seen in the pictures below. Aspergillus_silvaticus_cya.png|Aspergillus silvaticus growing on CYA plate Aspergillus_silvaticus_meaox.png|Aspergillus silvaticus growing on MEAOX plate == References == silvaticus Category:Fungi described in 1955
title: Aspergillus silvaticus
